00019 /*! \file
00020  * \brief Device state management
00021  *
00022  * \arg See \ref AstExtState
00023  */
00024 
00025 #ifndef _ASTERISK_DEVICESTATE_H
00026 #define _ASTERISK_DEVICESTATE_H
00027 
00028 #if defined(__cplusplus) || defined(c_plusplus)
00029 extern "C" {
00030 #endif
00031 
00032 /*! Device States */
00033 enum ast_device_state {
00034    AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN,      /*!< Device is valid but channel didn't know state */
00035    AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE,    /*!< Device is not used */
00036    AST_DEVICE_INUSE,        /*!< Device is in use */
00037    AST_DEVICE_BUSY,         /*!< Device is busy */
00038    AST_DEVICE_INVALID,      /*!< Device is invalid */
00039    AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE,  /*!< Device is unavailable */
00040    AST_DEVICE_RINGING,      /*!< Device is ringing */
00041    AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE,    /*!< Device is ringing *and* in use */
00042    AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD,       /*!< Device is on hold */
00043 };
00044 
00045 /*! \brief Devicestate watcher call back */
00046 typedef int (*ast_devstate_cb_type)(const char *dev, enum ast_device_state state, void *data);
00047 
00048 /*!  \brief Devicestate provider call back */
00049 typedef enum ast_device_state (*ast_devstate_prov_cb_type)(const char *data);
00050 
00051 /*! \brief Convert device state to text string for output 
00052  * \param devstate Current device state 
00053  */
00054 const char *devstate2str(enum ast_device_state devstate);
00055 
00056 /*! \brief Convert device state to text string that is easier to parse 
00057  * \param devstate Current device state 
00058  */
00059 const char *ast_devstate_str(enum ast_device_state devstate);
00060 
00061 /*! \brief Convert device state from text to integer value
00062  * \param The text representing the device state.  Valid values are anything
00063  *        that comes after AST_DEVICE_ in one of the defined values.
00064  * \return The AST_DEVICE_ integer value
00065  */
00066 enum ast_device_state ast_devstate_val(const char *val);
00067 
00068 /*! \brief Search the Channels by Name
00069  * \param device like a dialstring
00070  * Search the Device in active channels by compare the channelname against 
00071  * the devicename. Compared are only the first chars to the first '-' char.
00072  * Returns an AST_DEVICE_UNKNOWN if no channel found or
00073  * AST_DEVICE_INUSE if a channel is found
00074  */
00075 enum ast_device_state ast_parse_device_state(const char *device);
00076 
00077 /*! \brief Asks a channel for device state
00078  * \param device like a dialstring
00079  * Asks a channel for device state, data is  normaly a number from dialstring
00080  * used by the low level module
00081  * Trys the channel devicestate callback if not supported search in the
00082  * active channels list for the device.
00083  * Returns an AST_DEVICE_??? state -1 on failure
00084  */
00085 enum ast_device_state ast_device_state(const char *device);
00086 
00087 /*! \brief Tells Asterisk the State for Device is changed
00088  * \param fmt devicename like a dialstring with format parameters
00089  * Asterisk polls the new extensionstates and calls the registered
00090  * callbacks for the changed extensions
00091  * Returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
00092  */
00093 int ast_device_state_changed(const char *fmt, ...)
00094    __attribute__ ((format (printf, 1, 2)));
00095 
00096 
00097 /*! \brief Tells Asterisk the State for Device is changed 
00098  * \param device devicename like a dialstring
00099  * Asterisk polls the new extensionstates and calls the registered
00100  * callbacks for the changed extensions
00101  * Returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
00102  */
00103 int ast_device_state_changed_literal(const char *device);
00104 
00105 /*! \brief Registers a device state change callback 
00106  * \param callback Callback
00107  * \param data to pass to callback
00108  * The callback is called if the state for extension is changed
00109  * Return -1 on failure, ID on success
00110  */ 
00111 int ast_devstate_add(ast_devstate_cb_type callback, void *data);
00112 
00113 /*! \brief Unregisters a device state change callback 
00114  * \param callback Callback
00115  * \param data to pass to callback
00116  * The callback is called if the state for extension is changed
00117  * Return -1 on failure, ID on success
00118  */ 
00119 void ast_devstate_del(ast_devstate_cb_type callback, void *data);
00120 
00121 /*! \brief Add device state provider 
00122  * \param label to use in hint, like label:object
00123  * \param callback Callback
00124  * \retval -1 failure
00125  * \retval 0 success
00126  */ 
00127 int ast_devstate_prov_add(const char *label, ast_devstate_prov_cb_type callback);
00128 
00129 /*! \brief Remove device state provider 
00130  * \param label to use in hint, like label:object
00131  * Return -1 on failure, 0 on success
00132  */ 
00133 int ast_devstate_prov_del(const char *label);
00134 
00135 int ast_device_state_engine_init(void);
00136 
00137 #if defined(__cplusplus) || defined(c_plusplus)
00138 }
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 #endif /* _ASTERISK_DEVICESTATE_H */
